formulation: Japan Airlines Flight 516 crashes into Coast Guard plane and burns during landing at Haneda airport in Tokyo; all 379 passengers and crew on board the JAL Airbus evacuate safely, 5 of the 6 Coast Guard members are killed.
answer: A Japan Airlines Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner and a Coast Guard C-130 Hercules collided during landing at Haneda Airport in Tokyo, Japan, on January 2, 2024, resulting in injuries to several passengers and crew members.

formulation: Claudine Gay, Harvard University's first Black president, resigns following testimony to Congress on anti-semitism and amid plagiarism allegations.
answer: On January 7, 2024, Harvard University announced that Claudine Gay, its president, had been suspended indefinitely amid allegations of misconduct, including plagiarism and inappropriate behavior, following a series of investigations and reports from students and faculty.

formulation: A series of documents containing the names of associates of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein are made available to the public. A majority of those mentioned are found to not be directly involved in any wrongdoing.
answer: The Justice Department released a list of 100 individuals associated with Jeffrey Epstein, but clarified that most were not involved in any wrongdoing.

formulation: Two explosions kill at least 95 people during a commemorative ceremony marking the assassination of Qasem Soleimani in Kerman, Iran.
answer: A ceremony in Kerman, Iran, commemorated the assassination of General Qasem Soleimani, a prominent military figure, on January 3, 2024.

formulation: An Alaskan Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 makes emergency landing in Portland after a fuselage section blows out midair, with US regulator then grounding hundreds of planes.
answer: An Alaskan Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 crashes in Anchorage, Alaska, killing all 73 people on board, prompting the US Federal Aviation Administration to ground hundreds of planes.

formulation: Jeffery Epstein court documents listing his associates made public from 2015 defamation trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.
answer: Documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's associates were made public on January 3, 2024, stemming from a defamation trial involving Ghislaine Maxwell in 2015, revealing details about their alleged involvement in Epstein's sexual exploitation network.

formulation: The Michigan Wolverines defeat the Washington Huskies by a score of 34–13 to win the College Football Playoff National Championship.
answer: The College Football Playoff National Championship game held on January 8, 2024, saw the Alabama Crimson Tide defeat the Georgia Bulldogs with a score of 31-18.

formulation: Gabriel Attal named as France's youngest and first openly gay Prime Minister at 34, replacing Élisabeth Borne.
answer: France's President Emmanuel Macron appoints Gabriel Attal, a 36-year-old openly gay man, as the country's youngest and first openly gay Prime Minister.

formulation: The decision to seize Andrew Tate's assets is overturned by Bucharest's Court of Appeal after a successful appeal, ordering a new trial over the assets.
answer: A Romanian court ruled that Andrew Tate's assets, including his mansion and luxury cars, must be seized and sold to pay off his debts, marking a significant legal decision in the ongoing legal battle against him.

formulation: Nigerian film "A Tribe Called Judah", created by Funke Akindele, becomes the first Nollywood film to earn more than $1bn naira ($1.1m) domestically.
answer: 'A Tribe Called Judah', created by Funke Akindele, becomes the highest-grossing Nigerian film of all time, with domestic earnings of $10.5 million.

formulation: 2023 confirmed as the world's warmest year on record - 1.48C warmer than the long-term average, driven by climate change and El Niño.
answer: 2023 was the hottest year on record, with global temperatures 1.4 degrees Celsius (2.5 degrees Fahrenheit) above pre-industrial levels, according to the World Meteorological Organization.

formulation: Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE become BRICS members.
answer: On January 1, 2024, the BRICS alliance expanded to include Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE, marking a significant diversification of its membership and potential influence.

formulation: Criminal proceedings in the January 6 United States Capitol attack: Former Proud Boys member Christopher John Worrell is sentenced to 10 years in prison.
answer: On January 4, 2024, former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio was sentenced to 22 years in prison for his role in the January 6 Capitol attack, while other Proud Boys members were also sentenced for their involvement in the insurrection.

formulation: Israeli army claims it has destroyed Hamas's command centre in northern Gaza and killed more than 8,000 militants.
answer: The Israeli army announced a major military operation against Hamas in northern Gaza, targeting key infrastructure and launching a ground assault to disrupt the terrorist organization's capabilities.

formulation: Ethiopia makes a controversial deal with Somaliland to lease part of its coastline, including becoming the first country to recognise it as a separate country from Somalia.
answer: Ethiopia recognized Somaliland as an independent state on January 1, 2024, leading to a shift in their relationship and recognition status.

formulation: Alaska Airlines Flight 1282 suffers an uncontrolled decompression after one of the emergency exit doors on the Boeing 737 MAX 9 blows out, resulting in an emergency landing in Portland and the FAA grounding all 737 Max 9s.
answer: The grounding of all Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft in early January 2024 was due to safety concerns related to the aircraft's Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System (MCAS), which had been implicated in two previous fatal crashes, raising concerns about its reliability and potential for malfunction.

formulation: Armed gunmen storm a Ecuador Television network in Guayaquil during a live broadcast, amid a state of emergency in the country after increasing attacks and abductions.
answer: Armed gunmen attacked a television network during a live broadcast in Ecuador on January 9, 2024, resulting in the deaths of two journalists and injuries to several others.

formulation: Four people, including the perpetrator, are killed in a vehicle attack in Rochester, New York.
answer: A 21-year-old man fatally shot his girlfriend, her 16-year-old daughter, and his 16-year-old girlfriend in Rochester, New York, on January 1, 2024, before taking his own life.

formulation: Clashes break out at the World Headquarters of the Chabad-Lubavitch movement in Brooklyn, New York City after construction workers for the synagogue leaders attempted to fill in a tunnel that students had illegally dug beneath the building, resulting in the arrest of nine people. The incident causes antisemitic social media posts by far-right and QAnon figures to spread online.
answer: A conflict erupted in Brooklyn between construction workers and Chabad-Lubavitch movement members on January 8, 2024, leading to arrests and widespread social media backlash.

formulation: Harvard University president Claudine Gay announces her resignation following a contentious house hearing on antisemitism and allegations of plagiarism in her earlier academic career.
answer: Harvard University's president, Lawrence S. Bacow, announced that the university would conduct a comprehensive review of its policies and practices related to antisemitism and academic integrity, following a contentious house hearing that raised concerns about these issues.

formulation: In an all-English final, Luke Humphries claims his first PDC World Darts Championship with a 7-4 win over 16-year-old prodigy Luke Littler at the Alexandra Palace, London.
answer: Phil Taylor won his 13th PDC World Darts Championship title by defeating Michael van Gerwen 7-1 in the final.

formulation: Vulcan, NASA's first commercially financed moon mission launches from Cape Canaveral, Florida but its lander Peregrine develops problems soon after.
answer: NASA's first commercially financed moon mission, involving the lander Peregrine, faced issues during its landing attempt on the moon on January 8, 2024.

formulation: A magnitude 7.6 earthquake strikes Japan's western coast, killing an estimated 120 people and injuring more than 100.
answer: A magnitude 7.4 earthquake struck off the coast of Japan on January 1, 2024, causing widespread damage, triggering a tsunami, and resulting in at least 100 deaths and numerous injuries.

formulation: Public Domain Day: Books, films, and other works published in 1928 enter the public domain. The most notable work entering into the public domain is Steamboat Willie, the earliest version of Mickey Mouse, leading to the announcement of multiple works based on this version of the character.
answer: On January 1, 2024, works from 1928, including the debut of Mickey Mouse, will enter the public domain, allowing for free use and adaptation of these iconic creations.

formulation: Electronics brand LG unveils their Signature OLED T, the world's first wireless TV with a transparent screen at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas.
answer: LG unveiled the world's first 8K OLED TV at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas on January 8, 2024, offering unparalleled picture quality and immersive viewing experiences.
